abs: d-Erik Skouby and the people at the Center of Tele-Information for providing shelter in a pleasant atmosphere during most of the course of the Ph.D. and to Vagn Lauersen and his colleagues at the Ministry of Education for the opportunity to work on interesting practical problems. For my year of studies in Portugal, thanks go to Professor Jos Soeiro Ferreira and his group of pleasant people at Instituto de Engenharia de Sistemas e Computadores, Porto, Portugal. Also thanks to Maria Teresa Ponce de Leo, ngela Pereira and Ana Viana. I would like also to thank Professor Fred Glover, Professor Jacques Teghem, Professor Ralph Steuer and Professor Jrgen Tind for their help and useful comments and for being an inspiration to me by their own work. Also thanks to my two most important scientific friends and colleagues, Pedro Borges and Andrzej Jaszkiewicz. Finally, to my family and to my friends for their support and for just being the way they are. iv Metaheuristics for multiple objective c
